enWisdom: Generosity earns praise
Generosity earns praise
The eminent one is envied and the munificent one is loved and adored

Wisdom: الْجَوَادُ مَحْبُوبٌ مَحْمُودٌ وَإِنْ لَمْ يَصِلْ مِنْ جُودِهِ إِلَى مَادِحِهِ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَالْبَخِيلُ ضِدُّ ذَلِكَ
enWisdom: The generous person is loved and praised, even if nothing of his generosity reaches his praiser, and the stingy person is the opposite of this

Wisdom: الْجَوَادُ فِي الدُّنْيَا مَحْمُودٌ وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ مَسْعُودٌ
enWisdom: The one who is generous is praised in this world and felicitous in the Hereafter
Confer favours and you will be praised

Wisdom: أَنْعِمْ تُشْكَرْ وَارْهَبْ تَحْذَرْ وَلَا تُمَازِحْ فَتُحْقَرَ
enWisdom: Confer favours and you will be thanked, fear [Allah] and you will be feared [by the people] and do not crack [silly] jokes such that you are belittled

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَفْضَلَ مَا اسْتُجْلِبَ بِهِ الثَّنَاءُ السَّخَاءُ
enWisdom: The best thing by which praise is gained, is generosity; and the thing that draws forth the most abundant, lasting benefits is charity

Wisdom: وَإِنَّ أَجْزَلَ مَا اسْتُدِرَّتْ بِهِ الْأَرْبَاحُ الْبَاقِيَةُ الصَّدَقَةُ
enWisdom: The best thing by which praise is gained, is generosity; and the thing that draws forth the most abundant, lasting benefits is charity
By bearing the burden of provision [for the people], praises increase
Through generosity, praises are increased
Be generous with whatever you have, [and] you will be praised

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحَبَّ الذِّكْرَ الْجَمِيلَ فَلْيَبْذُلْ مَالَهُ
enWisdom: One who loves to be remembered with praise should give generously from his wealth
Nothing spreads renown like generosity
Generosity is a present honour
Give and you shall become capable (or be chosen)
The most generous of you is the one who will gain the most
If you confer favours, you will be served
Through generosity, actions become beautiful
By being generous with blessings, the blessings last longer
The fruit of nobleness is keeping ties with near relatives

Wisdom: لَنْ يَقْدِرَ أَحَدٌ أَنْ يَسْتَدِيمَ النِّعَمَ بِمِثْلِ شُكْرِهَا وَلَا يُزَيِّنُهَا بِمِثْلِ بَذْلِهَا
enWisdom: Nothing has the ability to make blessings last like showing gratitude for them and nothing beautifies them like granting them [to others]
